elements.title: John S. McCain Sr. (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that John S. McCain Sr. and John S. McCain Jr. (both pictured) were the first father-and-son pair to achieve the U.S. rank of four-star admiral?

elements.title: Víctimas del Vaciamiento (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the thrash metal band Hermética arranged to receive the gold certification for Víctimas del Vaciamiento on-stage during a concert?

elements.title: About People (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a scholar argued that the 2021 German novel About People, which is set during the COVID-19 pandemic in the country, encourages "sympathy with rightwing extremists"?

elements.title: cocoa smuggling (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that those found guilty of cocoa smuggling in Ghana face a maximum sentence of ten years in prison?

elements.title: Scott Jarvis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that actor Scott Jarvis was angered when White House officials under Richard Nixon requested that portions of his role in the musical 1776 be cut due to its anti-war theme?

elements.title: Dmitry (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1885 wreck of the cargo ship Dmitry was the inspiration for the arrival of Count Dracula in England in Bram Stoker's 1897 novel?

elements.title: Alexander Langmuir (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Alexander Langmuir created the Epidemic Intelligence Service to send epidemiologists across the world?

elements.title: Miss Indigenous Canada (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first Miss Indigenous Canada contestants were judged on ambassadorship, character, community service, and cultural involvement?

elements.title: Dogpool (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the character Dogpool was portrayed by "Britain's ugliest dog"?
